learning_outcomes.description: Apply rigorous mathematical reasoning, draw conclusions from empirical evidence, and efficiently implement relevant mathematical and statistical techniques.
Communicate ideas clearly, using examples, counterexamples, special cases, graphs, tables, and visualisation techniques where appropriate.
Situate findings within the context of the field's development, comparing and evaluating alternative approaches.
Reference original results accurately, using a consistent and appropriate bibliographic style.
Write with clarity, coherence, and strong organisational structure in a consistent style.

assessments.task_description:
Assessment procedures will be specified by the supervisor in the first week of semester.

Assessment items may include one or more of the following: assignments, literature surveys, seminars, exams, etc.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The report should be submitted via Turnitin by 4:00pm on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Directed Study

Students undertake a project under the supervision of a staff member.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Directed Study Students undertake a project under the supervision of a staff member.
